verses.verse: And Adam<WH120> knew<WH3045> <WH853> Eve<WH2332> his wife<WH802>; and she conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> <WH853> Cain<WH7014>, and said<WH559>, I have gotten<WH7069> a man<WH376> from<WH854> the LORD<WH3068>. Cain: that is, Gotten, or, Acquired

And she again<WH3254> bare<WH3205> his brother<WH251> Abel<WH1893>. And Abel<WH1893> was a keeper<WH7462> of sheep<WH6629>, but Cain<WH7014> was a tiller<WH5647> of the ground<WH127>. Abel: Heb. Hebel a keeper: Heb. a feeder

And in process<WH7093> of time<WH3117> it came to pass, that Cain<WH7014> brought<WH935> of the fruit<WH6529> of the ground<WH127> an offering<WH4503> unto the LORD<WH3068>. in process: Heb. at the end of days

And Abel<WH1893>, he<WH1931> also brought<WH935> of the firstlings<WH1062> of his flock<WH6629> and of the fat<WH2459> thereof. And the LORD<WH3068> had respect<WH8159> unto Abel<WH1893> and to his offering<WH4503>: flock: Heb. sheep, or, goats
But unto Cain<WH7014> and to his offering<WH4503> he had not respect<WH8159>. And Cain<WH7014> was very<WH3966> wroth<WH2734>, and his countenance<WH6440> fell<WH5307>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Cain<WH7014>, Why art thou wroth<WH2734>? and why is thy countenance<WH6440> fallen<WH5307>?

If<WH518> thou doest well<WH3190>, shalt thou not be accepted<WH7613>? and if thou doest not well<WH3190>, sin<WH2403> lieth<WH7257> at the door<WH6607>. And unto thee shall be his desire<WH8669>, and thou shalt rule<WH4910> over him. be accepted: or, have the excellency unto: or, subject unto thee

And Cain<WH7014> talked<WH559> with<WH413> Abel<WH1893> his brother<WH251>: and it came to pass, when they were in the field<WH7704>, that Cain<WH7014> rose up<WH6965> against<WH413> Abel<WH1893> his brother<WH251>, and slew him<WH2026>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Cain<WH7014>, Where<WH335> is Abel<WH1893> thy brother<WH251>? And he said<WH559>, I know<WH3045> not: Am I my brother's<WH251> keeper<WH8104>?
And he said<WH559>, What<WH4100> hast thou done<WH6213>? the voice<WH6963> of thy brother's<WH251> blood<WH1818> crieth<WH6817> unto me from the ground<WH127>. blood: Heb. bloods
And now art thou cursed<WH779> from the earth<WH127>, which hath opened<WH6475> her mouth<WH6310> to receive<WH3947> thy brother's<WH251> blood<WH1818> from thy hand<WH3027>;

When<WH3588> thou tillest<WH5647> the ground<WH127>, it shall not henceforth<WH3254> yield<WH5414> unto thee her strength<WH3581>; a fugitive<WH5128> and a vagabond<WH5110> shalt thou be in the earth<WH776>.
And Cain<WH7014> said<WH559> unto the LORD<WH3068>, My punishment<WH5771> is greater<WH1419> than I can bear<WH5375>. My: or, Mine iniquity is greater than that it may be forgiven

Behold, thou hast driven me out<WH1644> this day<WH3117> from the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>; and from<WH5921> thy face<WH6440> shall I be hid<WH5641>; and I shall be a fugitive<WH5128> and a vagabond<WH5110> in the earth<WH776>; and it shall come to pass<WH1961>, that every one that findeth me<WH4672> shall slay me<WH2026>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him, Therefore<WH3651> whosoever slayeth<WH2026> Cain<WH7014>, vengeance shall be taken<WH5358> on him sevenfold<WH7659>. And the LORD<WH3068> set<WH7760> a mark<WH226> upon Cain<WH7014>, lest<WH1115> any finding<WH4672> him should kill<WH5221> him.
And Cain<WH7014> went out<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of the LORD<WH3068>, and dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Nod<WH5113>, on the east<WH6926> of Eden<WH5731>.

And Cain<WH7014> knew<WH3045> his wife<WH802>; and she conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> Enoch<WH2585>: and he builded<WH1129> a city<WH5892>, and called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the city<WH5892>, after the name<WH8034> of his son<WH1121>, Enoch<WH2585>. Enoch: Heb. Chanoch

And unto Enoch<WH2585> was born<WH3205> Irad<WH5897>: and Irad<WH5897> begat<WH3205> Mehujael<WH4232>: and Mehujael<WH4232> begat<WH3205> Methusael<WH4967>: and Methusael<WH4967> begat<WH3205> Lamech<WH3929>. Lamech: Heb. Lemech
And Lamech<WH3929> took<WH3947> unto him two<WH8147> wives<WH802>: the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Adah<WH5711>, and the name<WH8034> of the other<WH8145> Zillah<WH6741>.
And Adah<WH5711> bare<WH3205> Jabal<WH2989>: he was the father<WH1> of such as dwell<WH3427> in tents<WH168>, and of such as have cattle<WH4735>.
And his brother's<WH251> name<WH8034> was Jubal<WH3106>: he was the father<WH1> of all such as handle<WH8610> the harp<WH3658> and organ<WH5748>.

And Zillah<WH6741>, she also bare<WH3205> Tubalcain<WH8423>, an instructer<WH3913> of every artificer<WH2794> in brass<WH5178> and iron<WH1270>: and the sister<WH269> of Tubalcain<WH8423> was Naamah<WH5279>. instructer: Heb. whetter

And Lamech<WH3929> said<WH559> unto his wives<WH802>, Adah<WH5711> and Zillah<WH6741>, Hear<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>; ye wives<WH802> of Lamech<WH3929>, hearken<WH238> unto my speech<WH565>: for I have slain<WH2026> a man<WH376> to my wounding<WH6482>, and a young man<WH3206> to my hurt<WH2250>. I have: or, I would slay a man in my wound, etc to my hurt: or, in my hurt
If<WH3588> Cain<WH7014> shall be avenged<WH5358> sevenfold<WH7659>, truly Lamech<WH3929> seventy<WH7657> and sevenfold<WH7651>.

And Adam<WH120> knew<WH3045> his wife<WH802> again<WH5750>; and she bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>, and called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Seth<WH8352>: For God<WH430>, said she, hath appointed<WH7896> me another<WH312> seed<WH2233> instead<WH8478> of Abel<WH1893>, whom<WH3588> Cain<WH7014> slew<WH2026>. Seth: Heb. Sheth: that is Appointed, or, Put

And to Seth<WH8352>, to him<WH1931> also there was born<WH3205> a son<WH1121>; and he called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Enos<WH583>: then began men<WH2490> to call<WH7121> upon the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>. Enos: Heb. Enosh to call: or, to call themselves by the name of the Lord
